revised_title: The Sign Reversal of the Electron-Releasing Effect of the Methyl Group
tldr: The authors discuss the history and sign reversal of the electron-releasing effect of the methyl group. They mention that in 1926, the late Professor Sir Christopher Ingold reversed the sign convention from -I to +I, as the differential coefficient of an increasing quantity is positive. This sign reversal has been generally accepted and is used worldwide.
